musegestures

Class MuseGestureServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • musegestures.MuseGestureServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    oscP5.OscEventListener

    public class MuseGestureServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements oscP5.OscEventListener
    The MuseGestureServer class is used to run methods on objects that implement MuseGestures, whenever an action is performed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MuseGestureServer(MuseGestures listener, int port)
      Initializes a MuseGestureServer with the given listener object and port.

      Sends the received OscMessage to the GestureAnalyzer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MuseGestureServer

        public MuseGestureServer(MuseGestures listener,
                         int port)
        Initializes a MuseGestureServer with the given listener object and port.
        Parameters:
        listener - The object that will receive the gesture method calls.
        port - The port of the Muse oscP5 server.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public boolean start()
        Starts the MuseGestureServer.
        Returns:
        true if the server successfully started, or false if it failed to start.

      • stop

        public boolean stop()
        Stops the MuseGestureServer.
        Returns:
        true if the server successfully stopped, or false if it failed to stop.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns whether or not the MuseGestureServer is running.
        Returns:
        true if the MuseGestureServer is running, or false if it is not.

        Changes the listener object of the MuseGestureServer to the newly specified object.

        Sends the received OscMessage to the GestureAnalyzer.

      • onGesture

        public void onGesture(MuseGesture gesture)
        Forwards the received gesture to the listener object.
